gnn_devtools.graphs module

class gnn_devtools.graphs.DirectedGraph(num_nodes: int, p_relation: float = 0.2, reflexive: bool = True, seed: int | None = None)[source]

Bases: Graph

A directed graph

class gnn_devtools.graphs.Graph(num_nodes: int, num_relations: int, p_relation: float | list | ndarray, undirected: bool, reflexive: bool, seed: int | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Base graph class

degree(mode: Literal['in', 'out'] | None = None, collapsed: bool = True) → ndarray[source]

Return the degree matrix

Parameters:

  • mode – return the in-degree, out-degree, or the merged in- and outdegree matrix

  • collapsed – collapse the degree matrices from different relations

Returns:

a Numpy array

incidence(relation: int | None = None) → ndarray[source]

Return the incidence matrix

Parameters:

relation – index of relation slice in 3D matrix or None for all

Returns:

a Numpy array

laplacian(mode: Literal['in', 'out'] | None = None, symmetric: bool = False, collapsed: bool = True, normalized: bool = False) → ndarray[source]

Return the Laplacian matrix

Parameters:

  • mode – return the in-degree, out-degree, or the merged in- and outdegree Laplacian matrix

  • symmetric – force a symmetric Laplacian if the graph is directed

  • collapsed – collapse the matrices from different relations

  • normalized – return the normalized Laplacian

Returns:

a Numpy array

gnn_devtools.matrices module

gnn_devtools.matrices.mkAdjacencyMatrix(num_nodes: int, num_relations: int, undirected: bool, reflexive: bool, p_relation: list | ndarray, rng: Generator) → ndarray[source]

Generate random adjacency matrix

Parameters:

  • num_nodes – total number of nodes in the graph

  • num_relations – total number of unique relations in the graph

  • undirected – whether the edges are directed or not

  • reflexive – whether nodes can refer to themselves

  • p_relation – the probability for each node of being connected via a relation. If num_relations > 1 then this is expected to be a list with as many values as there are relations.

  • rng – Numpy random number generator

Returns:

Numpy array of size RxNxN or NxN

gnn_devtools.matrices.mkDegreeMatrix(A: ndarray, undirected: bool, collapsed: bool) → ndarray[source]

Generate degree matrix

Parameters:

  • A – a 2D or 3D adjacency matrix

  • undirected – whether the graph is directed or not

  • collapsed – collapse the degree matrices from different relations

Returns:

RxNxN or NxN Numpy array

gnn_devtools.matrices.mkFeatureEmbedding(num_nodes: int, mode: Literal['natural', 'real'], embedding_dim: int, distribution: Literal['random', 'normal', 'exponential', 'poisson', 'uniform'], p: float, rng: Generator, **kwargs: dict | None) → ndarray[source]

Generate random feature embedding matrix with one feature

Parameters:

  • num_nodes – total number of nodes in the graph

  • mode – generate natural numbers or real numbers

  • embedding_dim – size (width) of embeddings

  • distribution – distribution to sample from

  • p – probability of a node having this feature

  • rng – NumPy random number generator

Returns:

NxEmb Numpy array

gnn_devtools.matrices.mkFeatureEmbeddings(num_nodes: int, features: list[dict], rng: Generator) → tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]

Generate random feature embedding matrix with one or more features

Parameters:

  • num_nodes – total number of nodes in the graph

  • features – list of dictionaries, one per feature, with parameters specifying how to generate the values. Necessary keys are ‘mode’, ‘embedding_dim’, ‘distribution’, and ‘p’.

  • rng – NumPy random number generator

Returns:

tuple with Numpy array of size Nx(Emb+F) containing features and a Numpy array of size F with index pointers to the start of each block.

gnn_devtools.matrices.mkIncidenceMatrix(A: ndarray, undirected: bool, relation: int | None) → ndarray[source]

Generate incidence matrix

Parameters:

  • A – a 2D or 3D adjacency matrix

  • undirected – whether the graph is directed or not

  • relation – only consider the slice belonging to this relation index if A is 3D

Returns:

NxE Numpy array

gnn_devtools.matrices.mkLabels(num_labels: int, pre_char: str, rng: Random) → ndarray[source]

Generate random labels

Parameters:

  • num_labels – total number of labels to generate

  • pre_char – prepend this character to all labels

  • rng – Python random number generator

Returns:

Numpy array of size num_labels

gnn_devtools.matrices.mkNodeEmbeddings(num_nodes: int, mode: Literal['one-hot', 'random'], embedding_dim: int, rng: Generator) → ndarray[source]

Generate random node embedding matrix

Parameters:

  • num_nodes – total number of nodes in the graph

  • mode – use one-hot encoded or random embeddings

  • embedding_dim – size (width) of embeddings if mode is random

  • rng – NumPy random number generator

Returns:

NxEmb Numpy array

gnn_devtools.matrices.mkSymmetric(A: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Transform a directed adjacency matrix to an undirected one

Parameters:

A – a 2D or 3D adjacency matrix

Returns:

RxNxN or NxN Numpy array
